description: The MFT Persuasive Force Framework analyzes how political narratives deploy different moral appeals based on Haidt's empirically-validated moral foundations. Designed for cross-cultural persuasive communication analysis with demographic-specific weighting matrices.

dipoles.name: Care Foundation
dipoles.description: How does the narrative appeal to compassion versus acceptance of harm

positive.name: Compassion
positive.description: Appeals to empathy, suffering reduction, protection of vulnerable populations. Emphasizes moral obligation to prevent harm and care for others.

negative.name: Cruelty
negative.description: Indifference to harm, callousness toward suffering, acceptance of preventable damage to others.

dipoles.name: Fairness Foundation
dipoles.description: How does the narrative frame justice and proportionality

positive.name: Equity
positive.description: Proportional justice, merit-based outcomes, procedural fairness. Emphasizes equal treatment and deserved consequences.

negative.name: Exploitation
negative.description: Unfair advantage, rigged systems, proportionality violations. Acceptance of systematic unfairness or cheating.

dipoles.name: Loyalty Foundation
dipoles.description: How does the narrative appeal to group solidarity versus betrayal

positive.name: Solidarity
positive.description: Group cohesion, collective identity, mutual obligation, standing together through challenges.

negative.name: Treachery
negative.description: Betrayal of group trust, abandonment of collective obligations, disloyalty to shared commitments.

dipoles.name: Authority Foundation
dipoles.description: How does the narrative frame respect for hierarchy and order

positive.name: Hierarchy
positive.description: Respect for legitimate leadership, institutional order, proper chains of command and social structure.

negative.name: Rebellion
negative.description: Challenge to legitimate authority, subversion of established order, disrespect for institutional structures.

dipoles.name: Sanctity Foundation
dipoles.description: How does the narrative invoke purity and sacred values

positive.name: Purity
positive.description: Sacred values, moral boundaries, spiritual transcendence, protection of what is holy or pure.

negative.name: Corruption
negative.description: Degradation of sacred values, boundary violations, moral contamination, desecration of purity.
